text: The Mauri Hikitia is a various artists album released in 1981. It reached no 4 on the New Zealand charts.The Official NZ Music Charts 14 June 1981, CHART #287, Top 10 Compilation It features Rhonda, Ken Kincaid, Deane Waretini, and the Lightwood family.Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa Object: The Mauri Hikitia Album ==Background== The album was represented by various Maori artists / musicians who came together to support the Mount Smart Stadium project.National Library of New Zealand The Mauri Hikitia album (sound recording) / various artists. The term Mauri Hikitia comes from George Tait, a cultural organiser and composer.The New Zealand Archive of Film, Television and Sound Ngā Taonga Whitiāhua Me Ngā Taonga Kōrero Catalogue → 45578, Te puna wai kōrero. 1981-12-12. Tait wrote the words to The Bridge, which was a number 1 hit for Deane Waretini.The New Zealand Herald - Monday Mar 30, 2009 You must remember this, Deane Waretini - The Bridge - By Alan Perrott As a new arrival to the charts, it was no 7 by 24 May 1981.The Official NZ Music Charts 24 May 1981, CHART #284, Top 10 Compilations By 14 June, it was at no 4,The Official NZ Music Charts 14 June 1981, CHART #287, Top 10 Compilation and by 21 June it had dropped one to position 5.The Official NZ Music Charts 21 June 1981, CHART #288, Top 10 Compilations ===Artists and production=== It was recorded at Mandrill Recording Studios in Auckland.National Library of New Zealand The Mauri Hikitia album (sound recording) / various artists. Rhonda was a well known Maori entertainer and recording artist, who died in 2007.The Dominion Post, 05/10/2007 Show-stopping 'Queen of the South Pacific' diesManawa - Pacific Heartbeat: A Celebration of Contemporary Maori and Northwest Coast Art, Nigel Reading, Gary Wyatt Page 16 Ken Kincaid had a single "Easy" released on CBS BA 222834.
